explains: v. 发噼啪声；给人紧张（或活泼）感
n. 噼啪声，爆裂声；（陶瓷器或玻璃上的）裂纹

sentences.en: Varnish applied over wet paint is likely to crackle.
sentences.cn: 清漆涂在未干的油漆上可能会产生裂纹。

sentences.en: Can they feel the crackle of electricity in the wind?
sentences.cn: 他们能否感受到风中的电光火石？

sentences.en: With a malicious crackle the old man held up a small white swaddling garment.
sentences.cn: 老头啪一声狠狠扯下毯子上的一个白色的小装饰。
